result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at  8:57am 
Defendant Delmorris Jose Boyd in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance today. 
Right to counsel is reviewed.  The Court requires Mr. Boyd to go now to the Clerk of Courts Office, Room 115, to complete and file a petition to request the appointment of counsel.  
Mr. Boyd indicates he is continuing to be at the 1409 W. Junction Road address, currently he is in Room 311.  However there are times when he needs to check out of the hotel due to occupancy levels, and then he finds housing at other hotels in Jefferson before returning there again.
recess 9:00am

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on September 8th at 10:00am

Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Conditions of Bond include:

--not to leave the State of Wisconsin

[MK] case called at 1:34pm
Defendant Delmorris Jose Boyd appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Boyd is employed locally, however the Columbus GA address on the Criminal Complaint should be used for mailing.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given. The Court directs the clerk to provide Mr. Boyd with a petition form to request the appointment of counsel, along with his bond paperwork. 
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits.

The Court requires a $500 Cash Bond with conditions:
--not to possess firearms or any dangerous weapons
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin 
recess 1:46pm. 

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on August 15th at 8:30am
